<script>
(function () {
    window.addEventListener('load', function () {
        setTimeout(function () {
            var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
            xhr.open('POST', '/_hcms/perf', true /*async*/);
            xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-type", "application/json");
            xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {
                // do nothing.
            };
            var connection = navigator.connection || navigator.mozConnection || navigator.webkitConnection;
            function populateNetworkInfo(name, connection, info) {
                if (name in connection) {
                    info[name] = connection[name];
                }
            }
            var networkInfo = {};
            if (connection) {
                ['type', 'effectiveType', 'downlink', 'rtt'].forEach(function(name) {
                    populateNetworkInfo(name, connection, networkInfo);
                });

<!-- Save UTM for links to app.scrapinghub.com -->
<script>
function getQueryStrParam(name, url) {
    if (!url) url = window.location.search;
    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
        results = regex.exec(url);
    if (!results) return null;
    if (!results[2]) return '';
    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
}

function storeUrlParam(param_name, url) {
    var hasCookie = getStoredParam(param_name);
    if (hasCookie == "" || hasCookie) return;
    var param = getQueryStrParam(param_name, url) || "";
    Cookies.set(param_name, param, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com",
        expires: 90
    })
}

function getStoredParam(param_name) {
    return Cookies.get(param_name, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com"
    })
}

function isPlatformLink(dest_url) {
    return (
        dest_url.startsWith("https://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("http://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("app.scrapinghub.com")
    )
}

jQuery(function ($) {
    $(document).on('click', 'a[cta_dest_link]', function(e) {
        const dest_url = $(e.currentTarget).attr("cta_dest_link");
        if ( dest_url && isPlatformLink(dest_url)) {
            storeUrlParam("utm_campaign", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_activity", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_medium", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_source", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_content", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_primary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_secondary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_goal", dest_url);
        }
    }); 
});
</script>
<!-- END save UTM tags -->

<style media="screen" type="text/css">
/* PrismJS 1.15.0
https://prismjs.com/download.html#themes=prism&languages=markup+css+clike+javascript+c+cpp+docker+erlang+git+json+latex+markdown+python+yaml */
/**
 * prism.js default theme for JavaScript, CSS and HTML
 * Based on dabblet (http://dabblet.com)
 * @author Lea Verou
 */

code[class*="language-"],
pre[class*="language-"] {
	color: black;
	background: none;
	text-shadow: 0 1px white;
	font-family: Consolas, Monaco, 'Andale Mono', 'Ubuntu Mono', monospace;
	text-align: left;
	white-space: pre;
	word-spacing: normal;
	word-break: normal;
	word-wrap: normal;
	line-height: 1.5;

	-moz-tab-size: 4;
	-o-tab-size: 4;
	tab-size: 4;

	-webkit-hyphens: none;
	-moz-hyphens: none;
	-ms-hyphens: none;
	hyphens: none;
}

pre[class*="language-"]::-moz-selection, pre[class*="language-"] ::-moz-selection,
code[class*="language-"]::-moz-selection, code[class*="language-"] ::-moz-selection {
	text-shadow: none;
	background: #b3d4fc;
}

pre[class*="language-"]::selection, pre[class*="language-"] ::selection,
code[class*="language-"]::selection, code[class*="language-"] ::selection {
	text-shadow: none;
	background: #b3d4fc;
}

@media print {
	code[class*="language-"],
	pre[class*="language-"] {
		text-shadow: none;
	}
}

/* Code blocks */
pre[class*="language-"] {
	padding: 1em;
	margin: .5em 0;
	overflow: auto;
}

:not(pre) > code[class*="language-"],
pre[class*="language-"] {
	background: #f5f2f0;
}

/* Inline code */
:not(pre) > code[class*="language-"] {
	padding: .1em;
	border-radius: .3em;
	white-space: normal;
}

.token.comment,
.token.prolog,
.token.doctype,
.token.cdata {
	color: slategray;
}

.token.punctuation {
	color: #999;
}

.namespace {
	opacity: .7;
}

.token.property,
.token.tag,
.token.boolean,
.token.number,
.token.constant,
.token.symbol,
.token.deleted {
	color: #905;
}

.token.selector,
.token.attr-name,
.token.string,
.token.char,
.token.builtin,
.token.inserted {
	color: #690;
}

.token.operator,
.token.entity,
.token.url,
.language-css .token.string,
.style .token.string {
	color: #9a6e3a;
	background: hsla(0, 0%, 100%, .5);
}

.token.atrule,
.token.attr-value,
.token.keyword {
	color: #07a;
}

.token.function,
.token.class-name {
	color: #DD4A68;
}

.token.regex,
.token.important,
.token.variable {
	color: #e90;
}

.token.important,
.token.bold {
	font-weight: bold;
}
.token.italic {
	font-style: italic;
}

.token.entity {
	cursor: help;
}

/* custom styling */
table {
  width: 100%;
  border-collapse: collapse;
}
th, td {
  padding: 0.7em;
}
table, th, td {
  border: 1px solid #ddd;
}
tbody tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background: #eee;
}
  
h2 {
  font-size: 30px;
}
h3 {
  font-size: 24px;
}
  
.post-header h2 a{
  font-size: 40px;
  text-align: center;
  }
</style>

<div id="hs_cos_wrapper_module_1523032069834331" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_widget hs_cos_wrapper_type_module widget-type-blog_content" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="widget" data-hs-cos-type="module">

<div class="blog-post-wrapper cell-wrapper">
<div class="blog-section">
<div class="blog-post-wrapper cell-wrapper">
<div class="post-page-content"> 
<div class="hs-featured-image-wrapper">
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/how-to-get-high-success-rates-with-proxies-3-steps-to-scale-up" title="" class="hs-featured-image-link">
<img src="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/hubfs/attila-scale.png" class="hs-featured-image" alt="High Success Rates With Proxies">

<div class="section post-header">
<h1><span id="hs_cos_wrapper_name" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="text">How to Get High Success Rates With Proxies: 3 Steps to Scale Up</span></h1>
<div class="byline">
<span class="date">
<i class="fa fa-calendar-o"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/how-to-get-high-success-rates-with-proxies-3-steps-to-scale-up">July 14, 2020 </a>
</span>
<span class="author">
<i class="fa fa-user"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/author/attila-tóth">Attila Tóth</a>	
</span>
<span class="custom_listing_comments">
<i class="fa fa-comments-o"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/how-to-get-high-success-rates-with-proxies-3-steps-to-scale-up#comments-listing">0 Comments</a>
</span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section post-body">
<span id="hs_cos_wrapper_post_body" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_rich_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="rich_text"><p><span style="font-style: italic;">In this article we give you some insight on how you can scale up your web data extraction project. You will learn what are the basic elements of scaling up and what are the steps that you should take when looking for the best <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://www.scrapinghub.com/crawlera" style="color: #990100;">rotating proxy solution</a></span>.</span></p>
<!--more-->
<div class="hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed" style="width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;">
<div class="hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper" style="position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;"><iframe class="hs-responsive-embed-iframe" style="position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;" xml="lang" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/1Dbs8G1M8l8" width="560" height="315" allowfullscreen data-service="youtube"></iframe></div>
</div>
<br>
<p>Generally, there are 3 steps needed to find the best proxy management method for your web scraping project and to make sure you can get data not just today but also in the future, long-term.</p>
<h2>3 steps to scale up web scraping</h2>
<h3>1. Traffic profile</h3>
<p>You need to define the traffic profile first to determine the concrete needs of your project. What is a traffic profile?</p>
<p>It includes, first of all, the <strong>websites</strong> that you're trying to get data from. And also if there's any technical challenges needed to be solved, like JS rendering.</p>
<p>The traffic profile also includes the <strong>volume</strong>, meaning how many requests do you want to or need to make per hour or per day. Also do you have any specific time window for the requests, like, for example you want to make all your requests only during work hours, for some reason. Or is it okay to get the data at night, when there's significantly less traffic hitting the site.</p>
<p>Then the last thing in the traffic profile is, <strong>geo locations</strong>. Because sometimes the website displays different content depending on where you are. So you need to use proxies that are in that specific region you need.</p>
<p>So these three elements together make the traffic profile: websites, volume and geo locations. Now, with these, you can determine the exact proxy situation that you need a solution for.</p>
<h3>2. Proxy pool</h3>
<p>The next step to scale up is to get a proxy pool. Based on the traffic profile, now you can estimate</p>
<ol>
<li>How many proxies you will need</li>
<li>Where those proxies should be located</li>
<li>The type of the proxies (data center or residential)</li>
</ol>
<p>You can get access to proxies directly from proxy providers, or through a proxy management solution as well. The drawback of getting proxies directly from providers -and not through a management solution - is that you need to do the managing yourself. There are a lot of things you need to look out for if you go with a provider that doesn’t provide management of proxies.</p>
<h3>3. Proxy management</h3>
<p>The final step is <strong>proxy management</strong>. Because it's not enough to have just a proxy pool. You also need to use the proxies efficiently. For example, some features that our smart <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://www.scrapinghub.com/crawlera" style="color: #990100;">proxy rotating</a></span> network has to manage proxies and maximize their value:</p>
<ul>
<li>intelligent proxy rotation</li>
<li>automatic header management</li>
<li>geolocation based on your needs</li>
<li>maintaining sessions</li>
</ul>
<p>But either you're using Crawlera, or you create your own proxy management solution there are some key points to focus on if you want long-term scalability.</p>
<h2>Long-term scalability</h2>
<p>First of all, <strong>make proxy management a priority</strong>. Because if you're extracting data at scale, most probably, you will not have issues with parsing HTML and writing the spider. But you WILL have issues with proxies. That's why it needs to be a priority.</p>
<p>Then, if you are managing your own proxies, it's important to keep the proxy pool clean and healthy. If you use a proper management service, it's not a problem, as that handles it for you.</p>
<p>Finally, my last point is to <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://www.scrapinghub.com/guides/web-scraping-best-practices" style="color: #990100;">be nice and respectful</a></span> to websites. Ultimately, it is a huge factor when scaling a web scraping project. You don't want to hit websites too hard and you need to make sure you follow the website's rules.</p>
<p>But again, if you're using a management tool, you will have a much easier time with proxies because everything is taken care of under the hood, you just need to send requests and extract the data.</p>
<h2>Learn more</h2>
<p>If you want to learn more, we have webinars on the topic of <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://info.scrapinghub.com/how-to-scale-your-web-scraping-with-proxies-reg" style="color: #990100;">scaling up</a></span> and also about how to <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://info.scrapinghub.com/how-to-scrape-the-web-without-getting-blocked-webinar-reg" style="color: #990100;">scrape without getting blocked</a></span>, where we go into more details.</p>
<p>And if you want to try Crawlera, the smart proxy network, you can do it for free.</p>
<p><!--HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --><span class="hs-cta-wrapper" id="hs-cta-wrapper-fdd2377b-45f9-4f83-a56a-d064b9e03216"><span class="hs-cta-node hs-cta-fdd2377b-45f9-4f83-a56a-d064b9e03216" id="hs-cta-fdd2377b-45f9-4f83-a56a-d064b9e03216"><!--[if lte IE 8]><div id="hs-cta-ie-element"></div><![endif]--><a href="https://cta-redirect.hubspot.com/cta/redirect/4367560/fdd2377b-45f9-4f83-a56a-d064b9e03216" target="_blank"><img class="hs-cta-img" id="hs-cta-img-fdd2377b-45f9-4f83-a56a-d064b9e03216" style="border-width:0px;margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px" src="https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/4367560/fdd2377b-45f9-4f83-a56a-d064b9e03216.png" alt="TRY CRAWLERA FOR FREE" align="middle"></a></span><script charset="utf-8" src="/hs/cta/cta/current.js"></script><script type="text/javascript"> hbspt.cta._relativeUrls=true;hbspt.cta.load(4367560, 'fdd2377b-45f9-4f83-a56a-d064b9e03216', {}); </script></span><!-- end HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --></p>
<p> </p></span>

<!-- Save UTM for links to app.scrapinghub.com -->
<script>
function getQueryStrParam(name, url) {
    if (!url) url = window.location.search;
    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
        results = regex.exec(url);
    if (!results) return null;
    if (!results[2]) return '';
    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
}

function storeUrlParam(param_name, url) {
    var hasCookie = getStoredParam(param_name);
    if (hasCookie == "" || hasCookie) return;
    var param = getQueryStrParam(param_name, url) || "";
    Cookies.set(param_name, param, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com",
        expires: 90
    })
}

function getStoredParam(param_name) {
    return Cookies.get(param_name, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com"
    })
}

function isPlatformLink(dest_url) {
    return (
        dest_url.startsWith("https://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("http://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("app.scrapinghub.com")
    )
}

jQuery(function ($) {
    $(document).on('click', 'a[cta_dest_link]', function(e) {
        const dest_url = $(e.currentTarget).attr("cta_dest_link");
        if ( dest_url && isPlatformLink(dest_url)) {
            storeUrlParam("utm_campaign", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_activity", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_medium", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_source", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_content", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_primary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_secondary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_goal", dest_url);
        }
    }); 
});
</script>

Data Center Proxies vs. Residential Proxies

July 21, 2020 Attila Tóth 0 Comment

In this blog post you are going to learn what’s the main difference between data center proxies and residential proxies. When to use data center and residential proxies in your web data extraction project to maximize successful requests

How to Get High Success Rates With Proxies: 3 Steps to Scale Up

/* PrismJS 1.15.0
https://prismjs.com/download.html#themes=prism&languages=markup+css+clike+javascript+c+cpp+docker+erlang+git+json+latex+markdown+python+yaml */
/**
 * prism.js default theme for JavaScript, CSS and HTML
 * Based on dabblet (http://dabblet.com)
 * @author Lea Verou
 */

code[class*="language-"],
pre[class*="language-"] {
	color: black;
	background: none;
	text-shadow: 0 1px white;
	font-family: Consolas, Monaco, 'Andale Mono', 'Ubuntu Mono', monospace;
	text-align: left;
	white-space: pre;
	word-spacing: normal;
	word-break: normal;
	word-wrap: normal;
	line-height: 1.5;

	-moz-tab-size: 4;
	-o-tab-size: 4;
	tab-size: 4;

	-webkit-hyphens: none;
	-moz-hyphens: none;
	-ms-hyphens: none;
	hyphens: none;
}

pre[class*="language-"]::-moz-selection, pre[class*="language-"] ::-moz-selection,
code[class*="language-"]::-moz-selection, code[class*="language-"] ::-moz-selection {
	text-shadow: none;
	background: #b3d4fc;
}

pre[class*="language-"]::selection, pre[class*="language-"] ::selection,
code[class*="language-"]::selection, code[class*="language-"] ::selection {
	text-shadow: none;
	background: #b3d4fc;
}

@media print {
	code[class*="language-"],
	pre[class*="language-"] {
		text-shadow: none;
	}
}

/* Code blocks */
pre[class*="language-"] {
	padding: 1em;
	margin: .5em 0;
	overflow: auto;
}

:not(pre) > code[class*="language-"],
pre[class*="language-"] {
	background: #f5f2f0;
}

/* Inline code */
:not(pre) > code[class*="language-"] {
	padding: .1em;
	border-radius: .3em;
	white-space: normal;
}

.token.comment,
.token.prolog,
.token.doctype,
.token.cdata {
	color: slategray;
}

.token.punctuation {
	color: #999;
}

.namespace {
	opacity: .7;
}

.token.property,
.token.tag,
.token.boolean,
.token.number,
.token.constant,
.token.symbol,
.token.deleted {
	color: #905;
}

.token.selector,
.token.attr-name,
.token.string,
.token.char,
.token.builtin,
.token.inserted {
	color: #690;
}

.token.operator,
.token.entity,
.token.url,
.language-css .token.string,
.style .token.string {
	color: #9a6e3a;
	background: hsla(0, 0%, 100%, .5);
}

.token.atrule,
.token.attr-value,
.token.keyword {
	color: #07a;
}

.token.function,
.token.class-name {
	color: #DD4A68;
}

.token.regex,
.token.important,
.token.variable {
	color: #e90;
}

.token.important,
.token.bold {
	font-weight: bold;
}
.token.italic {
	font-style: italic;
}

.token.entity {
	cursor: help;
}

/* custom styling */
table {
  width: 100%;
  border-collapse: collapse;
}
th, td {
  padding: 0.7em;
}
table, th, td {
  border: 1px solid #ddd;
}
tbody tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background: #eee;
}
  
h2 {
  font-size: 30px;
}
h3 {
  font-size: 24px;
}
  
.post-header h2 a{
  font-size: 40px;

<div class="hs-featured-image-wrapper">

<div class="section post-header">
<h1><span id="hs_cos_wrapper_name" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="text">Data Center Proxies vs. Residential Proxies</span></h1>
<div class="byline">
<span class="date">
<i class="fa fa-calendar-o"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/data-center-proxies-vs.-residential-proxies">July 21, 2020 </a>
</span>
<span class="author">
<i class="fa fa-user"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/author/attila-tóth">Attila Tóth</a>	
</span>
<span class="custom_listing_comments">
<i class="fa fa-comments-o"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/data-center-proxies-vs.-residential-proxies#comments-listing">0 Comments</a>
</span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section post-body">
<span id="hs_cos_wrapper_post_body" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_rich_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="rich_text"><p><em>In this blog post you are going to learn what’s the main difference between data center proxies and residential proxies. <i data-stringify-type="italic">When to use data center and residential proxies in your web data extraction project to maximize successful requests</i></em></p>
<!--more-->
<h2>Why would you even need proxies?</h2>
<p>But, first let's see why would you even need proxies. When you start extracting data from the web on a small scale you might not need proxies to make successful requests and get the data. But, as you scale your project because you need to extract more records or more frequently, you will experience issues. Or the site you're trying to reach might display different content depending on the region. So these are the two cases when you need to start using a proxy solution.</p>
<h2>Difference between data center and residential proxies</h2>
<p><span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_center" style="color: #990100;">Data center</a></span> proxies are much easier to get access to and they are much cheaper. In many use cases, where you cannot extract data without any proxy, you can just start using data center proxies and be able to extract data.</p>
<p>Residential proxies are harder to get access to and they are more expensive, because they are provided by actual Internet Service Providers and not data centers. Residential proxies are also higher quality and can work even when data center proxies fail.</p>
<h2>Which one is better for web scraping?</h2>
<p>Whether you should use data center or residential proxies in your web data extraction project, it comes down to your situation’s details. There’s no general rule of thumb to decide which type of proxy will work for you. But one thing is for sure: unless you have some special requirements you should start off with data center proxies. Then, based on how it works for you, you can switch to residential proxies if you really need to.</p>
<p>Residential proxies are more expensive, thus you will probably be better off using data center proxies, if you can, and applying some techniques to keep your proxy pool clean.</p>
<h2>Most effective way to use proxies in your web scraping project</h2>
<p>The biggest issue with residential proxies is, as it was mentioned, they are expensive. So usually the most effective way to scale your web data extraction project, is to try to maximize the value of data center proxies, by being smart about how you actually scrape the web and how you use proxies.</p>
<p>Two things, that you can do to achieve this:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>automatic proxy rotation</strong>:when a proxy fails you automatically assign a new one</li>
<li><strong>auto-throttling</strong>: you set your request frequency based on how the website reacts.</li>
</ul>
<p>If you want to learn more about these tactics, I recommend watching our FREE webinar on this: <span style="color: #990100; font-weight: bold;"><a href="https://info.scrapinghub.com/how-to-scale-your-web-scraping-with-proxies-reg" style="color: #990100;">How To Scale Your Web Scraping With Proxies.</a></span></p>
<h2>Learn more</h2>
<p>If you missed our webinar on the topic of data center proxies and residential proxies don’t worry you will be able to watch it here:</p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><!--HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --><span class="hs-cta-wrapper" id="hs-cta-wrapper-3a103458-c0f5-4a8e-94e7-b88897036497"><span class="hs-cta-node hs-cta-3a103458-c0f5-4a8e-94e7-b88897036497" id="hs-cta-3a103458-c0f5-4a8e-94e7-b88897036497"><!--[if lte IE 8]><div id="hs-cta-ie-element"></div><![endif]--><a href="https://cta-redirect.hubspot.com/cta/redirect/4367560/3a103458-c0f5-4a8e-94e7-b88897036497" target="_blank"><img class="hs-cta-img" id="hs-cta-img-3a103458-c0f5-4a8e-94e7-b88897036497" style="border-width:0px;" src="https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/4367560/3a103458-c0f5-4a8e-94e7-b88897036497.png" alt="VIEW RECORDING"></a></span><script charset="utf-8" src="/hs/cta/cta/current.js"></script><script type="text/javascript"> hbspt.cta._relativeUrls=true;hbspt.cta.load(4367560, '3a103458-c0f5-4a8e-94e7-b88897036497', {}); </script></span><!-- end HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --></p>
<p>If you feel like you know enough already and you don't want to spend way too much time on managing proxies, you can just use an already existing solution for <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://www.scrapinghub.com/crawlera" style="color: #990100;">proxy rotation and management</a></span>.</p></span>

            xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {
                // do nothing.
            };
            var connection = navigator.connection || navigator.mozConnection || navigator.webkitConnection;
            function populateNetworkInfo(name, connection, info) {
                if (name in connection) {
                    info[name] = connection[name];
                }
            }
            var networkInfo = {};
            if (connection) {
                ['type', 'effectiveType', 'downlink', 'rtt'].forEach(function(name) {
                    populateNetworkInfo(name, connection, networkInfo);
                });

                url: location.href,

                group: -1,
                connection: networkInfo,
                timing: performance.timing
            };
            xhr.send(JSON.stringify(perfData));

    });
})();

<!-- Save UTM for links to app.scrapinghub.com -->
<script>
function getQueryStrParam(name, url) {
    if (!url) url = window.location.search;
    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
        results = regex.exec(url);
    if (!results) return null;
    if (!results[2]) return '';
    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
}

function storeUrlParam(param_name, url) {
    var hasCookie = getStoredParam(param_name);
    if (hasCookie == "" || hasCookie) return;
    var param = getQueryStrParam(param_name, url) || "";
    Cookies.set(param_name, param, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com",
        expires: 90
    })
}

function getStoredParam(param_name) {
    return Cookies.get(param_name, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com"
    })
}

function isPlatformLink(dest_url) {
    return (
        dest_url.startsWith("https://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("http://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("app.scrapinghub.com")
    )
}

jQuery(function ($) {
    $(document).on('click', 'a[cta_dest_link]', function(e) {
        const dest_url = $(e.currentTarget).attr("cta_dest_link");
        if ( dest_url && isPlatformLink(dest_url)) {
            storeUrlParam("utm_campaign", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_activity", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_medium", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_source", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_content", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_primary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_secondary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_goal", dest_url);
        }
    }); 
});
</script>

THE SCRAPINGHUB BLOG

Turn Web Content Into Useful Data

Browsed by
Author: Himanshi Bhatt

Your Price Intelligence Questions Answered

July 28, 2020 Himanshi Bhatt 0 Comment

What is Price Intelligence?

Price Intelligence is leveraging web data to make better pricing, marketing, and business decisions. Basically, it is all about making use of the available data to optimize your pricing strategy, making it more competitive, increasing profitability, and ultimately, improving your business performance.

Read More

Keep up to date with web scraping and data tips...

A Practical Guide to Web Data Extraction: Part 2

Learn about the common validation pitfalls when it comes to web scraping. We have the answers.

<div id="hs_cos_wrapper_module_1523032069834331" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_widget hs_cos_wrapper_type_module widget-type-blog_content" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="widget" data-hs-cos-type="module">

<div class="blog-section">
<div class="blog-post-wrapper cell-wrapper">
<div class="post-page-content"> 
<div class="hs-featured-image-wrapper">
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/price-intelligence-questions-answered" title="" class="hs-featured-image-link">
<img src="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/hubfs/Your-Price-Intelligence-Questions-answered-blog-jul-2020-v1.gif" class="hs-featured-image" alt="">
</a>
</div>
<div class="section post-header">
<h1><span id="hs_cos_wrapper_name" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="text">Your Price Intelligence Questions Answered</span></h1>
<div class="byline">
<span class="date">
<i class="fa fa-calendar-o"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/price-intelligence-questions-answered">July 28, 2020 </a>
</span>
<span class="author">
<i class="fa fa-user"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/author/himanshi-bhatt">Himanshi Bhatt</a>	
</span>
<span class="custom_listing_comments">
<i class="fa fa-comments-o"></i>
<a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/price-intelligence-questions-answered#comments-listing">0 Comments</a>
</span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section post-body">
<span id="hs_cos_wrapper_post_body" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_rich_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="rich_text"><h2>What is Price Intelligence?</h2>
<p>Price Intelligence is leveraging web data to make better pricing, marketing, and business decisions. Basically, it is all about making use of the available data to optimize your pricing strategy, making it more competitive, increasing profitability, and ultimately, improving your business performance.</p>
<!--more-->
<p>From competitor monitoring to dynamic pricing and MAP monitoring, web extracted pricing data has endless uses. Brands and e-commerce companies use pricing data to monitor an overall view of the market. Dynamic pricing can be used to make automatic pricing decisions based on competitor’s data combined with internal data so that you always remain profitable. MAP or Minimum Advertising Price monitoring is a technique that uses web extracted data to ensure the resellers and partners are maintaining the pricing according to the company policies.</p>
<p>During our webinar on “<span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://info.scrapinghub.com/fuelling-price-intelligence-with-web-data-extraction-gate" style="color: #990100;">Fuelling Price Intelligence With Web Data Extraction</a></span>” in June 2020, we had a lot of questions related to the processes and challenges of pricing data extraction. We cover a few important questions here:</p>
<h3 style="font-size: 20px; font-weight: bold;"><strong>Q: While monitoring prices, how do you account for promotional codes? How do you automatically apply additional promotions codes that can be applied to the selling price as seen on the listing page?</strong></h3>
<p>A: It varies from website to website, but the general idea is to find the pages where such promotion codes are available and build the logic of looking up code and applying it (clicking a button or sending AJAX request) into your extraction code.</p>
<h3 style="font-size: 20px;"><strong>Q: How do you detect and act on the erroneous pricing that some websites intentionally showcase to confuse price intelligence efforts?</strong></h3>
<p>A: Websites showcase erroneous pricing data when they detect you scraping regularly. This especially happens when you are trying to scale - i.e scrape a lot of products very frequently. Erroneous pricing is not easily recognizable, but comparing the prices or other data fields with previously extracted data and manually checking if there is a big difference in the extracted data can help.</p>
<p>The long-term solution for this would be to be smarter about how you scale and be more thoughtful about the <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://www.scrapinghub.com/crawlera/" style="color: #990100;">proxy solutions</a></span> you use.</p>
<h3 style="font-size: 20px;"><strong>Q: How do you make sure that the data you scrape is accurate?</strong></h3>
<p>A: Scraping accurate data is all about having a reliable quality assurance process. The first step towards this process is to have a well-defined JSON schema. Your QA process needs to be a balanced combination of automated ways of testing the data as well as manual ways. This blog post gives a detailed description of <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://blog.scrapinghub.com/web-data-qa-part-iii-combining-manual-and-automated-techniques-for-holistic-data-validation" style="color: #990100;">data validation techniques</a></span>.</p>
<h3 style="font-size: 20px;"><strong>Q: What are the challenges in scraping prices from sites that are javascript heavy?</strong></h3>
<p>A: For javascript heavy sites, the simplest way would be to inspect the website and see if it uses any hidden APIs that have the data in JSON or other simple formats. This way, you can get the data without executing the javascript.</p>
<p>However, sometimes that may not work. In that case, you will need to execute the javascript using a headless browser like <span style="color: #990100;"><a href="https://www.scrapinghub.com/splash/" style="color: #990100;">Splash</a></span> or Selenium or Puppeteer. The challenge here is that it will consume more resources making the process more expensive.</p>
<h3 style="font-size: 20px;"><strong>Q: How do you match products across websites?</strong></h3>
<p>A: There are many ways to conduct product matching. The main idea would be to gather as many product-specific parameters as you can about the product that you want to match and then compare those parameters.</p>
<p>Eg: For a TV, the product-specific parameters would be resolution, weight, sound, etc. If in comparison, 90% of the parameters of any two products are the same, there is a high chance that it is the same product across two websites.</p>
<p>You can build models on this concept to identify product duplication.</p>
<h2><span>Price Intelligence Webinar</span></h2>
<p>Want to know more about how you can fuel your price intelligence decisions with web extracted data? Watch this webinar where our Technology Evangelist Attila Toth takes you on a deep dive through the main challenges affecting price intelligence projects from both a business and technical perspective, and more importantly, how you can solve them.</p>
<p><!--HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --><span class="hs-cta-wrapper" id="hs-cta-wrapper-786cfc77-4b78-4430-a3ce-fd5b48227518"><span class="hs-cta-node hs-cta-786cfc77-4b78-4430-a3ce-fd5b48227518" id="hs-cta-786cfc77-4b78-4430-a3ce-fd5b48227518"><!--[if lte IE 8]><div id="hs-cta-ie-element"></div><![endif]--><a href="https://cta-redirect.hubspot.com/cta/redirect/4367560/786cfc77-4b78-4430-a3ce-fd5b48227518" target="_blank"><img class="hs-cta-img" id="hs-cta-img-786cfc77-4b78-4430-a3ce-fd5b48227518" style="border-width:0px;margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px" src="https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/4367560/786cfc77-4b78-4430-a3ce-fd5b48227518.png" alt="Watch Now" align="middle"></a></span><script charset="utf-8" src="/hs/cta/cta/current.js"></script><script type="text/javascript"> hbspt.cta._relativeUrls=true;hbspt.cta.load(4367560, '786cfc77-4b78-4430-a3ce-fd5b48227518', {}); </script></span><!-- end HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --></p>
<p>If you have any more questions or queries on Price Intelligence data extraction, feel free to leave a comment below and we will try our best to answer them.</p>
<p> </p></span>

(function () {
    window.addEventListener('load', function () {
        setTimeout(function () {
            var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
            xhr.open('POST', '/_hcms/perf', true /*async*/);
            xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-type", "application/json");
            xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {
                // do nothing.
            };
            var connection = navigator.connection || navigator.mozConnection || navigator.webkitConnection;
            function populateNetworkInfo(name, connection, info) {
                if (name in connection) {
                    info[name] = connection[name];
                }
            }
            var networkInfo = {};
            if (connection) {
                ['type', 'effectiveType', 'downlink', 'rtt'].forEach(function(name) {
                    populateNetworkInfo(name, connection, networkInfo);
                });
            }
            var perfData = {
                url: location.href,
                portal: 4367560,
                content: 32737816533,
                group: -1,
                connection: networkInfo,
                timing: performance.timing
            };
            xhr.send(JSON.stringify(perfData));
        }, 3000);  // Execute this 3 seconds after onload.
    });
})();
</script>

<script>
function getQueryStrParam(name, url) {
    if (!url) url = window.location.search;
    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
        results = regex.exec(url);
    if (!results) return null;
    if (!results[2]) return '';
    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
}

function storeUrlParam(param_name, url) {
    var hasCookie = getStoredParam(param_name);
    if (hasCookie == "" || hasCookie) return;
    var param = getQueryStrParam(param_name, url) || "";
    Cookies.set(param_name, param, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com",
        expires: 90
    })
}

function getStoredParam(param_name) {
    return Cookies.get(param_name, {
        domain: ".scrapinghub.com"
    })
}

function isPlatformLink(dest_url) {
    return (
        dest_url.startsWith("https://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("http://app.scrapinghub.com") ||
        dest_url.startsWith("app.scrapinghub.com")
    )
}

jQuery(function ($) {
    $(document).on('click', 'a[cta_dest_link]', function(e) {
        const dest_url = $(e.currentTarget).attr("cta_dest_link");
        if ( dest_url && isPlatformLink(dest_url)) {
            storeUrlParam("utm_campaign", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_activity", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_medium", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_source", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_content", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_primary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_secondary", dest_url);
            storeUrlParam("utm_goal", dest_url);
        }
    }); 
});
</script>
